page.content: demand for cranes. A sister plant at Ripley, has been kept open in preference to the Horsehay works. The three acre site is now up for sale. An industrial tradition stretching back nearly two hundred and fifty years is now in danger of disappearance. With the demise of this major engineering works, heir to the iron- making traditions of the area, it is evident that a way of live co-habitant with the industrial revol;ution is all but dead. The coal mines, of which 50 years ago there were two dozen, are long gone. Their ghosts remaining a hazard to builders. There is a proposal to open an 'open-cast' mine in Horsehay and in the recent Miners' strike a firm called Action Waste Ltd, picked open cast coal at Little Wenlock.
